title: National Day of Remembrance for Charlie Kirk
summary: The document is a presidential proclamation declaring October 14, 2025, as a National Day of Remembrance for Charlie Kirk, who was assassinated on September 10, 2025. The proclamation honors Kirk's life, his contributions to the conservative movement, and his commitment to truth, faith, and open debate. It calls on Americans to gather in places of worship to pay homage to Kirk's memory, pray for peace, and renew their commitment to the principles he stood for. The proclamation also emphasizes the need to end political violence and continue Kirk's mission of promoting American ideals.
